pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.1: Nuns’ suspension 7, 8, and 9 are identical to the monks’ suspension 5 Bu Ss 5:0.4, 8 Bu Ss 8:0.4, and 9 Bu Ss 9:0.4 respectively.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.4: According to Sp-ṭ.3.709, kinnumāva should be read as kiṁ nu imā eva. Kinnumāva samaṇiyo yā samaṇiyo sakyadhītaro might then be rendered quite literally as, “Those ascetics who are daughters of the Sakyan (yā samaṇiyo sakyadhītaro), why are just these ones ascetics (kinnumāva samaṇiyo)?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.59: The Pali text just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, an offense. Yet just below the text says that the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.3.6: The Pali says the “seventh offense”, but since I am including the rules that the nuns have in common with the monks in the count, I get “tenth offense” instead. The same adjustment is required for the next three rules.
